headline.print_headline: Buffett Disapproves of Coca-Cola's Pay Plan
headline.main: Buffett Disapproves of Coca-Cola's Pay Plan

docs.snippet: Warren Buffett criticized Coca-Cola's pay plan for its executives on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett criticized Coca-Cola's pay plan for its executives on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Facebook First-Quarter Revenue Grows 72 Percent on Rising Mobile Ads
headline.main: Facebook First-Quarter Revenue Grows 72 Percent on Rising Mobile Ads

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc's mobile advertising business accelerated in the first three months of the year, helping the Internet social networking company top Wall Street's financial targets....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook Inc's mobile advertising business accelerated in the first three months of the year, helping the Internet social networking company top Wall Street's financial targets.

headline.print_headline: Jailed U.S. Contractor in Cuba Warns of Terminal Hunger Strike
headline.main: Jailed U.S. Contractor in Cuba Warns of Terminal Hunger Strike

docs.snippet: The lawyer for jailed U.S. contractor Alan Gross told the press in Havana on Wednesday that his client planned to return from Cuba to his family within the year, dead or alive, and called on the Obama administration to do more to obtain his releas...
docs.lead_paragraph: The lawyer for jailed U.S. contractor Alan Gross told the press in Havana on Wednesday that his client planned to return from Cuba to his family within the year, dead or alive, and called on the Obama administration to do more to obtain his release.

headline.print_headline: Armenian Leader Says Ankara Denies 'Genocide' but Turks Not Enemy
headline.main: Armenian Leader Says Ankara Denies 'Genocide' but Turks Not Enemy

docs.snippet: Armenian President Serzh Sarksyan accused Turkey of "utter denial" of what Armenia sees as the genocide of Armenians by the Ottoman Empire 99 years ago, but said his country does not consider Turks its enemy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Armenian President Serzh Sarksyan accused Turkey of "utter denial" of what Armenia sees as the genocide of Armenians by the Ottoman Empire 99 years ago, but said his country does not consider Turks its enemy.

headline.print_headline: UN Considering Sanctions Over South Sudan Massacre
headline.main: UN Considering Sanctions Over South Sudan Massacre

docs.snippet: The U.N. Security Council on Wednesday viewed "horrific pictures of corpses" from the scene of last week's massacre in South Sudan and discussed taking actions that could include sanctions, diplomats said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. Security Council on Wednesday viewed "horrific pictures of corpses" from the scene of last week's massacre in South Sudan and discussed taking actions that could include sanctions, diplomats said.

headline.print_headline: Pension Funds Pile Pressure on Barclays Over Governance
headline.main: Pension Funds Pile Pressure on Barclays Over Governance

docs.snippet: A group of British public sector pension funds has heaped pressure on Barclays ahead of its annual general meeting by saying it has governance concerns over the company's search for a new chairman....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of British public sector pension funds has heaped pressure on Barclays ahead of its annual general meeting by saying it has governance concerns over the company's search for a new chairman.

headline.print_headline: ND OKs Power Line in Historic Battlefield Area
headline.main: ND OKs Power Line in Historic Battlefield Area

docs.snippet: North Dakota regulators on Wednesday approved a permit for a proposed $375 million high-voltage power line that would run through the Killdeer Mountain Battlefield, a site in the western part of the state where a battle between U.S. Army soldiers ...
docs.lead_paragraph: North Dakota regulators on Wednesday approved a permit for a proposed $375 million high-voltage power line that would run through the Killdeer Mountain Battlefield, a site in the western part of the state where a battle between U.S. Army soldiers and American Indians occurred in 1864.

headline.print_headline: Oldest Ex-Major League Baseball Player Dies in Cuba at 102
headline.main: Oldest Ex-Major League Baseball Player Dies in Cuba at 102

docs.snippet: Conrado Marrero, at 102 the oldest former Major League Baseball player and a patriarch of Cuban baseball known for his quick wit and goofy pitching delivery, died on Wednesday at his home in Havana....
docs.lead_paragraph: Conrado Marrero, at 102 the oldest former Major League Baseball player and a patriarch of Cuban baseball known for his quick wit and goofy pitching delivery, died on Wednesday at his home in Havana.

headline.print_headline: Suarez to Make Nationwide Debut at Richmond
headline.main: Suarez to Make Nationwide Debut at Richmond

docs.snippet: Daniel Suarez has proven to be a quick learner in a race car, winning in the eighth race of last year's NASCAR's K&N Pro Series East Tour and finishing third in the final standings....
docs.lead_paragraph: Daniel Suarez has proven to be a quick learner in a race car, winning in the eighth race of last year's NASCAR's K&N Pro Series East Tour and finishing third in the final standings.

headline.print_headline: Batteries in Baby Video Monitors Recalled
headline.main: Batteries in Baby Video Monitors Recalled

docs.snippet: Summer Infant is recalling about 800,000 rechargeable batteries used in baby video monitors because of a burn hazard....
docs.lead_paragraph: Summer Infant is recalling about 800,000 rechargeable batteries used in baby video monitors because of a burn hazard.
